title: Push for ‘Net Zero’ Investments Could Bolster Demand for Alternatives
text:
The push towards “net-zero” emissions investments could enhance the charms of alternative investments such as timber and agriculture, Günther Thallinger, a member of the management board of Allianz SE, the giant insurer, told Barron’s in an interview.

“We will possibly be adding to forest and agriculture,” as negative carbon emitting investments, Thallinger said. Net zero also means earlier stage investments in carbon-capture technology, since there isn’t a listed vehicle, Thallinger said.

...
description: Those alternative investments could include timber and agriculture, says Günther Thallinger, a member of the management board of insurer Allianz.
